outcome: Petitioners have invoked the jurisdiction under Section 482 Cr.P.C to quash all proceedings against them. 2. Petitioners are the accused in Crime No.609/2023 of Elathoor Police Station, Kozhikode Dist
full_text: Biel pe eer ea Beer 2024/KER/8030 CRL.MC NO. 168 OF 2024 2 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE BECHU KURIAN THOMAS TUESDAY, THE 2382 DAY OF JANUARY 2024 / 3RD MAGHA, 1945 CRL.MC NO. 168 OF 2024 CRIME NO.609/2023 OF Elathur Police Station, Kozhikode PETITIONER/S: 1 GOKULDAS AGED 31 YEARS S/0 SIVANANDAN, VAISHNAVAM, PEEDIKAKANDY, EDAKKAD PO, KOZHIKODE, PIN - 673005 2 BABU AGED 76 YEARS S/0 UNNIPPACHCHU, PEEDIKAKANDY, EDAKKAD PO, KOZHIKODE, PIN - 673005 BY ADV C.R.JAYAKUMAR RESPONDENT/S: 1 STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, PIN - 682031 2 THE STATION HOUSE OFFICER ELATHOOR POLICE STATION, ELATHOOR PO, KOZHIKODE DISTRICT, PIN - 673303 3 ABDUL NAZAR M AGED 58 YEARS S/0 SEYTHUTTY HAJI, MUTHUVATTUSERI (VEEDU), VALIYAPARAMB, KODUVALLTI PO, KOZHIKODE, PIN - 673572 OTHER PRESENT: SMT. SREEJA V. (PP) THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 23.01.2024, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: 2024/KER/8030 CRL.MC NO. 168 OF 2024 2 BECHU KURIAN THOMAS, J. ~ Cri.M.C.No.168 of 2024 Dated this the 23 day of January, 2024 ORDER Petitioners have invoked the jurisdiction under Section 482 Cr.P.C to quash all proceedings against them. 2. Petitioners are the accused in Crime No.609/2023 of Elathoor Police Station, Kozhikode District. According to the prosecution, on 06.07.2023, the accused demolished the compound wall of the defacto complainants property and damaged an electric meter causing a loss of Rs.1,50,000/- and threatened to kill the workers of the defacto complainant and thereby alleged to have committed the offences under Sections 447, 427 and 506 r/w Section 34 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860. The 3% respondent is the defacto complainant 3. Heard the learned Counsel for the petitioners and the learned Counsel for the respondents, apart from the learned Public Prosecutor. 5. The learned Counsel for the petitioners submitted that the matter has been settled and hence the proceedings against the petitioners ought to be quashed. It was also submitted that, considering the nature of offences alleged, no purpose would be served by continuing the proceedings. Dales He ecg eee BiPaa rr 2024/KER/8030 CRL.MC NO. 168 OF 2024 3 6. In Gian Singh v. State of Punjab and another [(2012) 10 SCC 303], the Apex Court has held that in appropriate cases, the High Court can take note of the amicable resolution of disputes between the victim and the wrongdoer to put an end to the criminal proceedings. This view was reiterated in Narinder Singh v. State of Punjab [(2014) 6 SCC 466] and Yogendra Yadav and Others v. State of Jharkhand and Another [(2014) 9 SCC 653]. 7. | have perused Annexure A2 affidavit filed by the 3 respondent. The learned Public Prosecutor has submitted that upon verification, it is understood that the affidavit is genuine, and the defacto complainant stands by the contens thereof. | am satisfied that the matter has been settled and no public interest is involved in this case. There is no impediment for granting the prayer for quashing. The continuance of the proceedings will only be an exercise in futility. 8. Accordingly, all proceedings against the petitioners in Crime No.609/2023 of Elathoor Police Station, Kozhikode District are quashed. This Crl.M.C is allowed as above. sd/ BECHU KURIAN THOMAS JUDGE jm/ al tere apt 2024/KER/8030 CRL.MC NO. 168 OF 2024 4 APPENDIX OF CRL.MC 168/2024 PETITIONER ANNEXURES Annexure Ai TRUE COPY OF THE FIR IN CRIME NO. 609/2023 OF ELATHOOR POLICE STATION, KOZHIKODE DATED 11.07.2023 Annexure A2 THE AFFIDAVIT PREPARED BY THE 3RD RESPONDENT DATED 09/12/2023
